captions.text:
>>PLEASE GREEN MAN,
JUST LET ME GO.

I DON'T HAVE ANYTHING THAT YOU WANT.
>>THAT'S WHERE YOU ARE WRONG MISSY.

[EVIL LAUGH] >>WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT?
>>IRONICALLY, WORKING IN MY LABORATORY

THE NUCLEAR WEAPON IS FINALLY COMPLETE.
AFTER IT HAD BEEN WORKING GOOD IN MY LABORATORY

FOR HOURS.
I AM LITERALLY TICKLED THINKING ABOUT IT.

[EVIL LAUGHTER] [CLATTER OF A DOOR]
WHO'S THERE?

>>CAPTAIN LITERALLY.
>>CAPTAIN IRONY!

>>NUCLEAR NINJA.
>>THE GOOD AND THE WELL DUO.

>>AND DANGLING PARTICIPLE DUDE.
>>EVERYTHING WAS WRONG WITH THAT SENTENCE.

SO, WAIT-- WHO ARE YOU?
>>DANGLING PARTICIPLE DUDE.

>>EVERYONE'S HEARD OF HIM, BUT NO ONE ACTUALLY
KNOWS WHAT HE DOES.

>>WHATEVER.
YOU BROKE ALL THE RULES, SO NOW YOU'RE GOING

TO PAY.
>>THERE WAS NOTHING IRONIC ABOUT THE

SENTENCE YOU JUST USED.
YOU JUST TACKED THE WORD IRONICALLY IN FRONT

OF IT.
IRONY TAUGHT!

>>YOU SAID GOOD-- >>WHEN YOU SHOULD
HAVE SAID WELL.

>>GOOD AND WELL ARE DIFFERENT!
>>[LAUGHTER] >>THERE!

LITERALLY TICKLED.
BALANCE RESTORED!

>>WELL, YOUR PARTICIPLES WERE DANGLING ALL
OVER THE PLACE.
DANGLE SHAMANGLE.

>>SERIOUSLY? IS THAT ALL YOU GUYS DO?
[LAUGHTER] YOU GUYS ARE PATHETIC.

YOU EVER MISPRONOUNCE THE WORD NUCLEAR AGAIN,
YOU WILL SUFFER.
BECAUSE I'LL PUNCH YOU AGAIN.

>>WAIT! I THINK HE'S STILL CONSCIOUS BACK THERE!
AREN'T YOU GOING UNTIE ME?

>>OH, YEAH, WE'RE NOT REALLY THOSE KINDS
OF SUPERHEROES,

BUT IF YOU EVER HAVE AN EGREGIOUS
GRAMMATICAL ERROR WE'LL BE THERE!

HE'S WAKING UP!
[SCREAMING]
>>THANKS

title: Word Crimes busted by Grammar Avengers - Studio C

comments.text:
par·ti·ci·ple
ˈpärdəˌsip(ə)l/
nounGRAMMAR
a word formed from a verb (e.g., going, gone, being, been ) and used as an 
adjective (e.g., working woman, burned toast ) or a noun (e.g., good 
breeding ). In English, participles are also used to make compound verb 
forms (e.g., is going, has been ).﻿

comments.author: Sereina Keller

comments.text:
Other possible Grammar Superheros:
Grammar Nazi: A Nazi soldier who shows up when people use incorrect grammar 
on papers.
Spelling Bee: A person in a bee costume that shows up when people misspell 
things.
Improper Pronoun Professor: An old man who corrects people when they use 
improper pronouns.
Helping Verb Helper: Corrects people who don't use the proper Helping Verbs.
Sergent Quotations: A gruff military Sergent who insults people who don't 
use quotation marks.
Plagiarism Pilgrim: A Puritan who will whack people who plagiarize. 
Silent E-Man: Wearing tights embroidered with an E, this character will 
show up when people misuse or forget the Silent E.
Can you think of any others?﻿

whole skit!﻿
